CatDescriptText: Mrs. Bertha Harris, 217 Dinwiddie Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 19, 1958, pg. 9 with question: "Do you think that a business recession has hit the United States? If so, how has it affected you?" answer reads: "Yes, it has.  It hasn't affected me one way or the other.  However, I hope that it gets better before it does."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Bertha Harris wearing light colored sleeveless button down collared dress with pleating and eyeglasses, standing in front of New Diamond Market, Market Street, Downtown
